content: next stitch go outside to inside next stitch inside to outside repeating until you have one stitch left skip the last stitch and pull yarn through the loop you left at the start and gently pull to close the hole and tighten up loop www thefidghtyflower com © 2020 sarah quillen caterpillar 3 caterpillar finished size approx 13 long yarn colors 1 ball 5 3 oz / 150g bernat blanket deep sea hook us k 10 5 / 6 5mm other materials safety eyes 10mm polyester fiberfill head / body round 1 magic_ring with 8 single_crochet place marker round 2 increase in each st around 16 round 3 increase single_crochet in next st repeat around 24 round 4-5 single_crochet in each st around round 6 invdec single_crochet in next st repeat around 16 round 7 invdec single_crochet in next 3 sts 3 times single_crochet in last st eye placement 13 round 8 increase single_crochet in next 3 sts 3 times single_crochet in last st 16 round 9 increase single_crochet in next st repeat around 24 attach eyes between round 2 and 3 with 5 sts in between the eyes stuff round 10-11 single_crochet in each st around round 12 invdec single_crochet in next st repeat around 16 round 13 invdec single_crochet in next 3 sts 3 times single_crochet in last st 13 round 14 increase single_crochet in next 3 sts 3 times single_crochet in last st 16 eye placement from the side round 15 increase single_crochet in next st repeat around 24 www thefidghtyflower com © 2020 sarah quillen caterpillar 4 round 16-17 single_crochet in each st around round 18-35 repeat round 12- 17 3 times stuff each ball after it is made round 36 invdec single_crochet in next st repeat around 16 round 37 invdec repeat around 8 add more stuffing close and finish off round 17 complete all balls complete antenna make 2 join yarn in round 3 above eye chain 3 half_double_crochet in 2nd chain from hook slip_stitch in next chain slip_stitch in the same st as the join on the head fasten_off secure to head and finish off antenna placement
